abstract: Initial tests in Glendive, Montana show water that is free of benzene, carcinogenic component of oil that had been released during spill of crude oil from Bridger Pipeline conduit; if confirmed, tests mean that residents will be able to drink tap water for first time since 40,000 gallons of oil were spilled into the Yellow Stone River.
lead_paragraph: Initial tests of water supplies show no sign of a cancer-causing element for the first time since they were contaminated by a crude oil spill over the weekend, a state official said.
snippet: Initial tests of water supplies show no sign of a cancer-causing element for the first time since they were contaminated by a crude oil spill over the weekend, a state official said.

headline.main: Montana: Tests Show Water Appears Free of Carcinogens
headline.print_headline: Montana: Tests Show Water Appears Free of Carcinogens
